suggestions.suggestion: Help me find ways to defend myself here. I want to maintain my stance, without coming across as defensive or really aggressive.
suggestions.purpose: Sometimes, out of your own self-respect, you do need to push back, maintain your stance, and that is exactly what we are trying to achieve with this line of prompting.

suggestions.suggestion: How can I hold space so the other person continues to feel comfortable speaking further?
suggestions.purpose: It's wonderful they have shared this with you, it shows a sign of trust, and how can you respond in kind showing you are capable of receiving what they have given?

suggestions.suggestion: I want to talk about <topic>. I feel ready to say something, but I'm not sure how to start the conversation.
suggestions.purpose: Sometimes the thoughts build up and speaking something at all feels too heavy, so how can you begin to entertain the concept with your partner?

suggestions.suggestion: How can I get more intriguing information?
suggestions.purpose: You find this topic interesting, but don't want the straight-forward responses. Let's get to the exciting material!

suggestions.suggestion: I want to challenge the teacher here. What are ways I can do so?
suggestions.purpose: Just looking to have some fun, or you seriously want to put your teacher's knowledge to the test? Let's find ways to make your teacher think.

suggestions.suggestion: How can I show I have some basic knowledge in the space too?
suggestions.purpose: Demonstrate your interest and curiosity by mirroring you share knowledge of he subject, too.
